tool_description: Convert animated image files like GIF to WebP format (it keeps the animation while compressing). And directly upload / send to your Amazon AWS S3 Bucket without any other call. It is super easy. It can compress 100 times original files and 3-5 times to compressed files This endpoint is referenced as "C2" in our postman collection. We provide very detailed documentation there. Please check our postman documentation for full info.
name: C2- Transcode/Optimize Gif & Upload Your AWS S3 Bucket
title: C2- Transcode/Optimize Gif & Upload Your AWS S3 Bucket
tool_name: C2- Transcode/Optimize Gif & Upload Your AWS S3 Bucket

api_list.name: C2- Transcode/Optimize Gif & Upload Your AWS S3 Bucket
api_list.description:
you must have AWS IAM user credentials with "putObject"
if you don't have, then check our A2 api, it returns temporary download link.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://c2-transcode-optimize-gif-upload-your-aws-s3-bucket.p.rapidapi.com/apifsp/transcoder/upload-to-aws-s3/animated-photo"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "c2-transcode-optimize-gif-upload-your-aws-s3-bucket.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://c2-transcode-optimize-gif-upload-your-aws-s3-bucket.p.rapidapi.com/apifsp/transcoder/upload-to-aws-s3/animated-photo"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "c2-transcode-optimize-gif-upload-your-aws-s3-bucket.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
